titleStmt.title: Description of The John Rylands Library, Hebrew MS 7: Rylands Ashkenazi Haggadah

notesStmt.note: Different later hands have made marginal additions to the text: folios 1b, 4b, 5b, 6b, 8a, 9b, 15b, 30b-32a, 33a.

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a fifteenth-century illuminated Ashkenazi Haggadah, with commentaries.

msItem.title: Directions for observances peculiar to the first two Passover nights in brown ink (commentary)
Marginalia: later additions in black ink

supportDesc.foliation: Modern pencil foliation in Arabic numerals at top outer corner of side a

layoutDesc.layout: Main text in long lines of between 5 and 12 written lines; surrounded, mostly on the outer margins, by commentaries; lead pencil ruling

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Several of the additions were made by an Italian semi-cursive hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Typical illuminated Ashkenazi haggadah where images are integrated with the Hebrew text; decoration was completed in two stages: the first one by the scribe Avraham ben Asher, the second one by a different artist; decoration can be subdivided into four types: 1. Illuminated initial-word panels on folios 1b, 5a, 5b, 20b, 25b, 27b, 28a, 33a, 47a, 48a, 49b; 2. Micrography on folios 4a, 4b, 6a, 6b, 20a, 20b, 21a; 3. Marginal painted depictions on folios 12a, 15b, 29a, 39b, 42b, 47a; 4. Painted illustrations on folios 1b, 5a, 5b, 9b, 10a, 10b, 14a, 23b, 24b, 25b, 33a, 34b
1bBurnished gold initial-word ברוך on a rectangular green panel
1bMarginal decoration, Stag hunt and grotesques
4aMicrography in the shape of a wooden staff or branch
4bMicrography in the shape of a wooden staff or branch
5aBurnished gold initial-word הא on a red panel decorated with fine brush strokes
5aMarginal decorations, Historiated with scenes representing the order from the start of the seder until the meal.
5aMarginal decorations, Animals and grotesques
5bSmall miniature, a man pours wine for the second cup
5bSmall miniature, a woman hangs a curtain
6aMicrography in the shape of a dragon
6bMicrography in the shape of two fish; one fish bites the other's tail
9bMarginal decoration, Bust of the wise son
10aMarginal decoration, the wicked son depicted as a soldier holding a sabre and wearing a crown
10bMarginal decoration, Bust of the simple son depicted as a jester
12aTwo small ink drawings of hands
14aMarginal decoration, Naked children cavorting in a field and trees; the image illustrates the text: כצמח השדה רבבה
20aMicrography in the shape of a running horse
20bMicrography in the shape of a winged dog
21aMicrography in the shape of Jonah being swallowed by the whale
23bMarginal decoration, Hand holding a piece of matza
24bMarginal decoration, Hand holding bitter herbs
25bSmall miniature, Blue panel with the initial-word לפיכך
27bPale green and red panel with the initial-word הללויה. The first part is gilded, the second silvered.
28aBlue panel with the initial-word בינאת
33aBlue panel with the initial-word שפוך
33aMarginal decoration, the Messiah, armed and riding a white ass, is greeted by an angel at the gates of a city, probably Jerusalem.
34bMarginal decoration, Small painting of a well
39bMarginal decoration, a finger pointing to the commentary in the margin
42bMarginal decoration, Grotesque figure with the words למולך עביר מדבר
47aRed panel with the initial-word ץאומ. Small drawing of a hand holding a ring
47aMarginal decoration, Small drawing of a hand holding a ring
48aRed, blue and green panel with the initial-word אז
49bYellow and green panel with the initial-word כי

binding.p: Brown leather binding, with an imprinted image of a seated man playing a wind instrument
